intro: Xolanthes guttatus, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid regions.
